text:
*[Bug 18880] Missing cross references between help pages?*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18880>

--- Comment #2 from Lluís (<mailto:lluis.revilla@gmail.com|lluis.revilla@gmail.com>) ---
Dear Kurt, 

With 1) I refer to help pages that may have cross reference to other help pages
but they form a network not tied to the global base R network of help pages.

For example grid's absolute.size.Rd has two cross references that are resolved
to a single help page, grids' widthDetails.Rd, which in turn only links back to
grids' absolute.size.Rd. 
Without going to grid's index help page (or starting from a different help
page) the user can't navigate outside these two help pages and relate these
functions to other content.

I found this disconnected links network happens on three different pairs of
help pages (in base R) and are shown at the bottom of the first comment (the
output of `bhc`).
